intro: Bossiaea virgata, commonly known as the slender bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in various regions across southern Australia. It has slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Bossiaea virgata is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract native pollinators.
